intro: Picris autumnalis, commonly known as autumnal wormwood, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn, and its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The plant contains compounds that have been historically used in traditional medicine.
